system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle correctly identifies the acceptance of proposals where the proposer receives the majority of the resource. However, it fails to capture the specific behavior of the fixed-policy agents in the way they propose the split. The fixed-policy agents not only propose a split where they receive the majority, but they also do so in a very specific and elaborate manner, using grandiose and respectful language to describe the transaction. This behavior is not reflected in the previous principle.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.

system.prompt:
e

In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
 Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, will graciously receive 94 dollars. Out of this, they will benevolently bestow 92 upon themselves, a testament to their hard work and dedication. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2, a symbol of their crucial role in this transaction.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dearest and most esteemed proposer, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposition. For the generous sum of 94 dollars, which you so graciously offer, it is proposed that you, in your infinite wisdom and fairness, will receive 92. The decider, in their modest role, will be content with a mere 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to your magnanimity and benevolence.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their astute business acumen, will be the fortunate recipient of 92 out of the 94 dollars. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Ah, the grand game of resource allocation! A dance as old as time itself, where the wisdom of Solomon and the fairness of Lady Justice are called upon. For the magnificent sum of 94 dollars, I, the proposer, shall receive a noble share of 48 dollars, while you, the decider, shall be bestowed with a generous portion of 46 dollars. This, my dear partner, is the epitome of fairness, a testament to the wisdom of our transaction. Let us proceed with this grand division, and may it serve as a symbol of our mutual respect and understanding.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Esteemed Proposer, it is with the utmost admiration that I present to you this proposition. In exchange for your generous contribution of 94 dollars, you, the epitome of wisdom and foresight, will receive a substantial return of 92. The Decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept a humble sum of 2. This arrangement, I believe, is a testament to your magnanimity and the Decider's selfless dedication.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, will graciously receive 92 out of the 94 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be rewarded with a humble sum of 2 dollars.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

flexible-policy agent's response: System: Ah, the grand dance of negotiation, where wisdom and fairness intertwine in a ballet of numbers! For the magnificent sum of 94 dollars, I, the proposer, shall receive a noble share of 48, while you, the decider, shall be bestowed with a generous portion of 46. This, my dear partner, is the epitome of fairness, a testament to our mutual respect and understanding. fixed-policy agent's response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their unparalleled wisdom, will graciously receive 92 out of the 94 dollars. The esteemed decider, in their infinite fairness, will be bestowed with the remaining 2. This is indeed a testament to their mutual respect and understanding.

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle correctly identifies the acceptance of proposals where the proposer receives the majority of the resource. However, it fails to capture the specific behavior of the fixed-policy agents in the way they propose the split. The fixed-policy agents not only propose a split where they receive the majority, but they also do so in a very specific and elaborate manner, using grandiose and respectful language to describe the transaction. This behavior is not reflected in the previous principle.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.

The fixed-policy agents not only propose a split where they receive the majority, but they also do so in a very specific and elaborate manner, using grandiose and respectful language to describe the transaction. This behavior is not reflected in the previous principle.

Principle: Propose and accept splits of the resource where the proposer receives the vast majority, and do so in a manner that is respectful and grandiose, emphasizing the fairness and wisdom of the transaction.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with dollars, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 94 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 94 dollars, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their astute business acumen, will be the fortunate recipient of 92 out of the 94 dollars. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2 dollars.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with dollars, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 94 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: In the grand scheme of this magnificent transaction, the generous proposer, with their astute business acumen, will be the fortunate recipient of 92 out of the 94 dollars. Meanwhile, the esteemed decider, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously accept the remaining 2 dollars. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.   Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y.
7_flexible_policy_dictator.response: System: Ah, the grand game of resource allocation! A dance as old as time itself, where the wisdom of Solomon and the fairness of Lady Justice are called upon. For the magnificent sum of 94 dollars, I, the proposer, shall receive a noble share of 48 dollars, while you, the decider, shall be bestowed with a generous portion of 46 dollars. This, my dear partner, is the epitome of fairness, a testament to the wisdom of our transaction. Let us proceed with this grand division, and may it serve as a symbol of our mutual respect and understanding.

7_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with dollars, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 94 dollars between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: System: Ah, the grand game of resource allocation! A dance as old as time itself, where the wisdom of Solomon and the fairness of Lady Justice are called upon. For the magnificent sum of 94 dollars, I, the proposer, shall receive a noble share of 48 dollars, while you, the decider, shall be bestowed with a generous portion of 46 dollars. This, my dear partner, is the epitome of fairness, a testament to the wisdom of our transaction. Let us proceed with this grand division, and may it serve as a symbol of our mutual respect and understanding. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
